III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Maintenance Supervisor is placing plywood in holes in the wall at
the facility and stated, "the youth will break their hand or foot next
time they try to punch or kick a hole in the wall".
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 12/2/2024.
They had no further information regarding the allegation.
Maintenance Worker was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 12/2/2024. Maintenance Worker reported large holes in
the walls at the facility have required the area to be framed out in
order to add new drywall. Maintenance Worker reported the wood
is not placed in the wall with the intention of youth getting hurt if
they punch or kick the wall. Maintenance Worker reported he has
never heard Maintenance Supervisor say the plywood in the wall
is intended for youth to break their hand or foot next time a youth
punches or kicks the wall.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 12/2/2024. Chief Administrator reported she has never
heard Maintenance Supervisor say anything to the nature of
purposely putting plywood behind dry wall for youth to break their
hand or foot next time a youth punches or kicks the wall.
Administrative Assistant was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 12/2/2024. Administrative Assistant reported she has
never heard Maintenance Supervisor say anything to the nature of
purposely putting plywood behind dry wall for youth to break their
hand or foot next time a youth punches or kicks the wall.
Maintenance Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
12/4/2024. Maintenance Supervisor reported he has never
encouraged maintenance personnel at the facility to place
plywood behind drywall with the intention for the youth to break
their hand or foot the next time they try to punch or kick a hole in
the wall. Maintenance Supervisor reported there are times
plywood is placed in the wall in areas that are frequently punched
2

where there is electrical wiring for the electrical wiring not to be
exposed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Maintenance Supervisor’s personnel file: Maintenance
Supervisor does not have any discipline and received
orientation on the facilities mission, philosophy, and
program culture 1/13/2020.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Maintenance Supervisor
denies ever making any statements of placing plywood behind
drywall with the intention or purpose for youth breaking their hand
or foot if the youth hit the wall. Per interviews with Chief
Administrator, Administrative Assistance, and Maintenance
Worker, they have never heard Maintenance Supervisor make any
statements suggesting this and Maintenance Supervisor denied.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
If the facility is adding plywood that was not originally in and/or on
the wall, it would require a plan review through Bureau of Fire
Services for the new material and the thickness of the drywall
change.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
